intro: Marginariopsis, commonly known as the "sea holly," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiny leaves and showy, blue or purple flowers. These plants are typically found in coastal areas and saline environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. Marginariopsis species often have a basal rosette of leaves and produce small, herbaceous stems. They play a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for small marine and terrestrial organisms.
